title: To Find: A Substitute For Lacuna and FF Good Wide Light
content:
Any ideas:

what kind of similar typeface could be used as a substitute for both of these?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173411im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lacuna_4433.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173411im_/http:/typophile.com/files/goodwidelight_4438.gif)
author: halloran

comments.content:
What do you like about them? What don't you like about them?

[FF Good Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173411/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_good_wide_light_lf_osf/) can be licensed for $44.00 — not that expensive considering what you get. And [Lacuna](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173411/http:/www.dafont.com/lacuna.font) is free.

thanks Miss Tiffany.

I like them both, I just am curious if there is another typeface upon which they are based or are similar to (like cousins, for example...) !

Apparently, FF Good Wide Light is free too, however, when you visit the FF site, it is not featured under the "free" downloads... I am just a little disappointed is all and looking for an alternative.

Yes. FF Good Wide Light was a featured free font last month I believe.

They are quite different from one another. But I gather you are leaning toward FF Good, yeah? And you are hoping for Free? While I'd really suggest licensing FF Good as it will become a tool\* which you can use again and again. But, if it is free that you are after I can point you toward:

- [40+ Excellent Freefonts For Professional Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173411/http:/www.smashingmagazine.com/2007/11/08/40-excellent-freefonts-for-professional-design/).  
- [FAQ Free Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173411/http:/typophile.com/node/44453) Typowiki entry.

\*Always better to opt for quality in terms of tools to be used in the long term.

Hey Miss Tiffany!

Thanks very much.

Yes, I agree, I think at a certain point... (when income is sufficient) it will be a definite priority to obtain the finest versions of fonts of the highest quality. For now, I am trying my best to be considerate and also to use the faces which best suit my needs and my client's desires...

Thank you anyways and I will consider your thoughts in my purchase-decisions in the future.

Take care,

Jaz
